qas.question: What has the U.S military proposed?

answers.text: building a new aircraft carrier berth on Guam

qas.question: How many Marines would the United States move to Guam?
Because of the EPA, how many Marines would the United States be able to send to Guam to live?
How many marines are stationed in Okinawa, Japan?
How many dependents of Marines are there in Okinawa, Japan?
How many dependents of Marines are now allowed in Guam?
What type of military base does the U.S. military have in Okinawa, Japan?
How many construction workers had the U.S. military been planning to have in Guam to build a new aircraft carrier berth?

context: The U.S. military has proposed <a0_0>building a new <b6_0>aircraft carrier berth<b6_0/> on Guam<a0_0/> and moving <a1_0><b3_0>8,600<b3_0/> Marines<a1_0/>, and <b4_0><b7_0>9,000<b7_0/><b4_0/> of their dependents, to Guam from Okinawa, Japan. Including the required construction workers, this buildup would increase Guam's population by 45%. In a February 2010 letter, the United States Environmental Protection Agency sharply criticized these plans because of a water shortfall, sewage problems and the impact on coral reefs. By 2012, these plans had been cut to only have a maximum of <a2_0><b5_0>4,800<b5_0/> Marines<a2_0/> stationed on the island, two thirds of which would be there on a rotational basis without their dependents.
